question.para: In the Event Logs for the Intrusion Prevention Appliance, I see references to an attack on XYZ mail server, yet we do not run XYZ server. Why is this?

answer.para: Attackers often try to exploit known security holes for a server whether or not such a server is present or running. They try everything in the hopes of finding an unprotected system.

question.para: How is the Intrusion Prevention Appliance different from Rogue Protocol Control?

answer.para: Although both are signature based, the Rogue Protocol Control appliance blocks software applications which, although potentially time wasting or unwanted, do not attempt to harm your protected network.
